Content:: Mohamed Marjan Faleel Asmi (born 10 June 1962) is a Sri Lankan politician and Member of Parliament.[1] Faleel was born on 10 June 1962.[1] He is the son of Faleel Hajjiar, former Chairman of the Beruwala Urban Council.[2] Faleel also served as chairman of the urban council.[2] Following the 2020 parliamentary election he was appointed to the Parliament of Sri Lanka as a National List MP representing the Sri Lanka People's Freedom Alliance.[3][4][5] This article about a politician from Western Province, Sri Lanka is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
